stimulusHtml: Which of the following is the transformed graph for  y = f x + 1 - 2 {"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}  ?

features.html:
Moving from left to right:

  • There are four connected line segments and a semicircle that is connected to the last line segment.
  • The first line segment begins at point (negative 3 comma 2) and ends at point (negative 2 comma 2).
  • The second line segment begins at point (negative 2 comma 2) and ends at point (negative 1 comma 0).
  • The third line segment begins at point (negative 1 comma 0) and ends at point (0 comma 1).
  • The fourth line segment begins at point (0 comma 1) and ends at point (1 comma negative 1).
  • The semicircle of radius 1 begins at point (1 comma negative 1), passes through point (2 comma negative 2), and ends at point (3 comma negative 1).

The graph of  y = f x {"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} , consisting of four line segments and a semicircle, is shown for -3≤x≤3{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}.

choicesHtml:
​

Moving from left to right:

  • There are four connected line segments and a semicircle that is connected to the last line segment.
  • The first line segment begins at point (negative 4 comma 0) and ends at point (negative 3 comma 0). 
  • The second line segment begins at point (negative 3 comma 0) and ends at point (negative 2 comma negative 2).
  • The third line segment begins at point (negative 2 comma negative 2) and ends at point (negative 1 comma negative 1).
  • The fourth line segment begins at point (negative 1 comma negative 1) and ends at point (0 comma negative 3).
  • The semicircle of radius 1 begins at point (0 comma negative 3), passes through point (1 comma negative 4), and ends at point (2 comma negative 3).

​

Moving from left to right:

  • There are four connected line segments and a semicircle that is connected to the last line segment.
  • The first line segment begins at point (negative 2 comma 0) and ends at point (negative 1 comma 0).
  • The second line segment begins at point (negative 1 comma 0) and ends at point (0 comma negative 2).
  • The third line segment begins at point (0 comma negative 2) and ends at point (1 comma negative 1).
  • The fourth line segment begins at point (1 comma negative 1) and ends at point (2 comma negative 3).
  • The semicircle of radius 1 begins at point (2 comma negative 3), passes through point (3 comma negative 4), and ends at point (4 comma negative 3).

​

Moving from left to right:

  • There are four connected line segments and a semicircle that is connected to the last line segment.
  • The first line segment begins at point (negative 5 comma 1) and ends at point (negative 4 comma 1).
  • The second line segment begins at point (negative 4 comma 1) and ends at point (negative 3 comma negative 1).
  • The third line segment begins at point (negative 3 comma negative 1) and ends at point (negative 2 comma 0).
  • The fourth line segment begins at point (negative 2 comma 0) and ends at point (negative 1 comma negative 2).
  • The semicircle of radius 1 begins at point (negative 1 comma negative 2), passes through point (0 comma negative 3), and ends at point (1 comma negative 2).

​

Moving from left to right:

  • There are four connected line segments and a semicircle that is connected to the last line segment.
  • The first line segment begins at point (negative 1 comma 1) and ends at point (0 comma 1).
  • The second line segment begins at point (0 comma 1) and ends at point (1 comma negative 1).
  • The third line segment begins at point (1 comma negative 1) and ends at point (2 comma 0).
  • The fourth line segment begins at point (2 comma 0) and ends at point (3 comma negative 2).
  • The semicircle of radius 1 begins at point (3 comma negative 2), passes through point (4 comma negative 3), and ends at point (5 comma negative 2).
